channel.title: game not showing in steam library
channel.description: the install directory said it saved in steam aps,mods but its not showing up in the library? where is the short cut?

item.title: game not showing in steam library
item.dc:creator: rxwookie
item.description:
Just a quick follow-up… if you have a successful install, you must completely exit Steam and restart before it will show in your library.

This is more than just clicking the X in the upper right corner. You must stop it from running in the background. You can either stop it from the system tray (lower right corner of windows) or just reboot your computer.

It should show up at the top, Black Mesa.

Read full topic
item.source: game not showing in steam library

item.title: game not showing in steam library
item.dc:creator: farth213
item.description:
konduktans:

Reinstalled the game to the default path and it worked great. Just copy the folder “SAVE” from the old /dir to the new!

yes i reinstalled the game and problem solved

Read full topic
item.source: game not showing in steam library

item.title: game not showing in steam library
item.dc:creator: konduktans
item.description:
Reinstalled the game to the default path and it worked great. Just copy the folder “SAVE” from the old /dir to the new!

item.source: game not showing in steam library

item.title: game not showing in steam library
item.dc:creator: cacahill
item.description:
Should be under steamapps\common\sourcemods in a dir called \BMS. IF you can’t afford the space wherever your steamapps are stored, you can make a Junction\simlink in sourcemods to wherever you extracted the game to. A little tricky, but easy to do if you set up for it right.

Read full topic
